'CÃ©line Marie Claudette Dion', (; born 30 March 1968) is a Canadian singer. Born
into a large family from Charlemagne, Quebec, Dion emerged as a teen
star in the French-speaking world after her manager and future husband RenÃ©
AngÃ©lil mortgaged his home to finance her first record. [http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Pop_Encyclopedia/D/Dion_Celine.html CÃ©line
Dion Biography]. "Canoe Jam!". Retrieved 13 September 2007. In 1990, she
released the English-language album [[Unison (Celine Dion album)|Unison]],
establishing herself as a viable pop artist in North America and other English-
speaking areas of the world. {{cite web | title=The Canadian
Encyclopedia | work=CÃ©line Dion Biography | url=http://www.thecanadianencyclope-
dia.com/index.cfm?PgNm=TCE&Params=U1ARTU0000970
| accessdate=14 July 2006 }}

Dion had first gained international recognition in the 1980s by winning both the
1982 Yamaha World Popular Song Festival and the 1988 Eurovision Song Contest
where she represented Switzerland. Bliss, Karen. "25 Years of
Canadian Artists." Canadian Musician. 1 March 2004, p. 34. ISSN:
07089635 Following a series of French albums in the early
1980s, she signed on to CBS Records Canada in 1986. During the 1990s, with the
help of AngÃ©lil, she achieved worldwide fame after signing with Epic Records and
releasing several English albums along with additional French albums, becoming
one of the most successful artists in pop music history. Taylor,
Chuck. "Epic/550's Dion offers Hits." Billboard. 6 November 1999, p.
1. "[http://www.cnn.com/CNN/Programs/people/shows/dion/profile.html The
Ultimate Diva]". CNN. 22 October 2002. Retrieved 13 September 2007.
However, in 1999 at the height of her success, Dion announced a hiatus from
entertainment in order to start a family and spend time with her husband, who
had been diagnosed with cancer. Celine Dion.
"Interview with Celine Dion." Peter Nansbridge. The National. With Alison Smith.
[[CBC Television|CBC-TV]]. 28 March 2002. Transcript. She returned to the
top of pop music in 2002 and signed a three-year (later extended to almost five
years) contract to perform nightly in a five-star theatrical show at the
Colosseum at Caesars Palace, Paradise, Nevada. Helligar, Jeremy.
"CÃ©line Dion livin' la vida Vegas!." Us. 31 March 2003, p.
56. "[http://www.digitaljournal.com/article/34152?tp=1 Celine Dion
Releases 1st CD Since 1997]". (15 April 2002). Digital Journal Retrieved (12
October 2009)

Dion's music has been influenced by genres ranging from rock and R&B to gospel
and classical. Her main singing languages are French and English, but she also
sings in Spanish, Italian, German, Latin, Japanese and Mandarine Chinese. While
her releases have often received mixed critical reception, she is renowned for
her technically skilled and powerful vocals. Alexander, Charles
P. [http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,980285,00.html The Power of
Celine Dion]". [[Time (Magazine)|Time]]. 7 March 1994 Gardner, Elysa. Review: Falling Into You. [[Los Angeles Times]] Los
Angeles, Calif.: 16 November 1997, p. 68 Dion is the
best-selling Canadian artist of all time, "[http://www.allbusiness.com/retail-trade/miscellaneous-retail-
retail-stores-not/4599216-1.html Dion Named All-time Best-selling Canadian
Act]". (6 January 2000). Allbusiness. Retrieved 12 October
2009. Learn, Josh "[http://media.www.brockpress.com/media/storage/pap-
er384/news/2009/03/10/ArtsEntertainment/High-
Fidelity.Top.Selling.Canadian.Artists-3666963.shtml High Fidelity: Top Selling
Canadian Artists]". The Brock Press. Retrieved 12 October 2009. is the
second best-selling female artist in the US during the Nielsen SoundScan
era, and is the only female artist to have two singles
sell more than a million copies in the
UK. [http://www.theofficialcharts.com/artist/_/CELINE%20DION/ Featured
Artists Celine Dion] Official Charts Company. Retrieved 3 October 2010. In
addition, her 1995 album [[D'eux]], is the best-selling French-language album of
all time. "[http://www.cbc.ca/arts/music/celinedion.html The real CÃ©line:
CÃ©line Dionâs new French album shows her personal side]" 29 May 2007. CBC.
Retrieved 12 October 2009. In 2004, after surpassing 175 million in album
sales worldwide, she was presented with the Chopard Diamond Award at the World
Music Awards for becoming the best-selling female artist of all time. [http://www.canada.com/topics/news/story.html?id=90da7aa0-f97e-4bc1-
9985-1fb521cf0d5e&k=20045 Celine Dion honoured by World Music Awards] Canada.com
Retrieved 1 December 2010 [http://www.ctv.ca/CTVNews/Entertainment/20-
040914/dion_award040914/ World Music Awards to honor Celine Dion] CTV News
Retrieved 1 December 2010 According to Sony Music Entertainment, Dion has
sold over 200 million albums worldwide.
